alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 12:48PM PST until November 08 at 3:45PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Ventura. * WHEN...Until 345 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas as well as over roadways. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rainfall. Rainfall rates of a quarter to half inch per hour have been observed with this rain band. Locally heavier rates of 0.75 to 1 inch per hour have been observed in upslope areas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Moorpark, Port Hueneme, and Point Mugu. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
